intro: Sanicula marylandica, commonly known as Maryland cow-wheat, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant features compound leaves with three to five leaflets and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring. It thrives in moist, shady habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it plays a role in supporting local ecosystems.
